1:
O God, act mercifully toward me\q2 because you love me faithfully;
\q2 because you are very merciful,
\q2 forget the ways that I disobeyed you!
\q1
2:
Make me acceptable to you again, even though I did wrong things;\q2 forgive the guilt of my sin and accept me.



\q1
3:
I say that because I know the ways that I have disobeyed you;\q2 I cannot forget them.
\q1
4:
You, you only, are the one I that have really sinned against,\q2 and you have seen the evil things that I have done.
\q1 When you say that I am guilty, you are right,
\q2 and when you judge me, you justly say that I deserve to be punished.


\q1
5:
I have been a sinner since the day that I was born;\q2 truly, I have been like that since my mother conceived me.
\q1
6:
What you desire is that in my inner being I desire what is true\q2 in order that you can teach me in my inner being how to act wisely.



\q1
7:
Forgive the guilt of my sins, and after that happens, I will be completely acceptable to you;\q2 if you forgive me, then I will be absolutely right with you.
\q1
8:
Allow me to rejoice again;\q2 you have made me immeasurably sad,
\q1 but now let me rejoice again.
\q1
9:
Do not continue to remember the sins that I have committed;\q2 forget the evil things that I have done.



\q1
10:
O God, make me want to do the things that you approve of.\q2 Make me want to do only what is right.
\q1
11:
Do not reject me as one of your people,\q2 and do not make your holy Spirit leave me.


\q1
12:
Make me happy again by rescuing me from my guilt,\q2 and always help me by making me sincerely want to obey you.
\q1
13:
If you do that, I will teach other sinners what you want them to do;\q2 they will repent and obey you.


\q1
14:
O God, you are the one who saves me;\q2 forgive me for being guilty of causing someone who was not my enemy to die.
\q2 When you do that, I will sing joyfully about your being very good and righteous.
\q1
15:
O Yahweh, help me to speak\q2 in order that I may praise you.
\q1
16:
When people only bring sacrifices to you, that does not please you.\q2 If that were enough to please you, I would do the same.
\q1 But you are not pleased with burnt offerings alone.


\q1
17:
The sacrifice that you really want is for people to be truly humble and sorry for having sinned.\q2 O God, you will not refuse that kind of sacrifice.
\q1
18:
O God, be good to the people who live in Jerusalem;\q2 make them able to rebuild the city walls.
\q1
19:
When that happens, they will bring you the proper sacrifices:\q2 normal animal sacrifices and sacrifices to be completely burned.
\q2 They will burn young bulls on your altar,
\q2 and you will be pleased.
